message_1: Suppose you have a block cipher that operates on 64-bit blocks and uses a key of length 128 bits. If you encrypt a message of length 192 bits using this cipher, how many blocks of ciphertext will be produced?
message_2:
To encrypt a message of length 192 bits using a block cipher that operates on 64-bit blocks, you would divide the message into blocks of 64 bits each. 

192 bits / 64 bits per block = 3 blocks

So, the encryption process will produce 3 blocks of ciphertext.
